name: reddit-tui
readme_summary: Reddittui is a terminal application for browsing Reddit using keyboard navigation.  It supports viewing posts and comments, offers configuration options for caching and filtering, and allows opening post links in a web browser. The application uses the bubbletea framework and provides various keyboard shortcuts for navigation and actions.
primary_use_case: Browsing Reddit from the command line

name: LLMDog
readme_summary: LLMDog is a command-line tool that helps prepare files for large language models.  It features an interactive terminal UI for easy file selection, supports recursive selection and .gitignore rules, and outputs a well-formatted Markdown report copied to the clipboard. This streamlines the process of providing files to LLMs.
primary_use_case: Prepare files for LLM consumption by selecting files and directories, generating a Markdown report of their structure and contents, and copying the output to the clipboard.

name: Notemod
readme_summary: Notemod is an open-source note-taking app that allows users to create and manage notes with rich text formatting, tasks, and local data storage.  It supports offline access and offers export/import functionality for data management.  The application is designed for ease of use and accessibility.

name: steam-miniprofile
description: Feature your Steam's miniprofile on your website
readme_summary: This tool embeds a user's public Steam miniprofile onto a website.  It supports various languages, featured games, and interactive elements, all without needing an API key. The miniprofile is loaded as an HTML entity and can be customized with CSS.
key_features: Loads Steam miniprofile with animated background and frame as an HTML entity
Supports multiple languages via query parameter 'lang'
Displays featured game with playtime using query parameter 'appId'
Allows interactive miniprofile with click to open Steam profile using parameters 'interactive' and 'vanityId'
Uses Steam's public API; no API key required
primary_use_case: Embedding a Steam miniprofile on a website

name: WebRover
description: WebRover is an autonomous AI agent designed to interpret user input and execute actions by interacting with web elements to accomplish tasks or answer questions. It leverages advanced language models and web automation tools to navigate the web, gather information, and provide structured responses based on the user's needs.
readme_summary: WebRover is an AI agent combining autonomous web browsing with advanced research capabilities.  It features three specialized agents for various tasks,  a modern chat interface, and tools for deep research including academic paper generation.  The system uses cutting-edge LLMs and browser automation for reliable and efficient web interaction.
key_features: Three specialized agents (Task, Research, Deep Research) with dynamic selection based on task complexity
Real-time agent state visualization and streaming actions/thoughts
Local browser instance for privacy and control, multi-tab management, PDF handling, secure sessions
Modern chat interface with real-time updates, interactive agent selection, action streaming, page annotations/highlights
Direct chat responses, one-click Google Docs export, PDF download, copy to clipboard
Vector store for information retention, multi-source verification, academic paper generation, reference management
GPT-4o, o3-mini-high, Claude-3.5 sonnet LLM integration, RAG pipeline, LangGraph for state management, Playwright for web automation
primary_use_case: AI-powered web agent for autonomous browsing, task automation, and deep research

name: audiobook-creator
description: Audiobook Creator is an open-source tool that converts books (EPUB, PDF, TXT) into fully voiced audiobooks with intelligent character voice attribution. It uses NLP, LLMs, and Kokoro TTS to generate engaging, multi-voice audiobooks. Features include text cleaning, character identification, and customizable narration. Licensed under GPL-3.0.
readme_summary: This repository provides tools to convert text books into audiobooks.  It supports multiple input and output formats, offers single and multi-voice narration options, and uses NLP for character identification and metadata generation.  The generated audiobooks are in M4B format, including cover and chapter timestamps.
key_features: Multi-Format Output Support (AAC, M4A, MP3, WAV, OPUS, FLAC, PCM, M4B)
primary_use_case: Audiobook generation from various text formats (EPUB, PDF, etc.) using NLP, LLMs, and TTS technologies.

name: DeeperSeek
description: An unofficial Python wrapper for DeepSeek API
readme_summary: DeeperSeek is a Python library that automates interactions with the DeepSeek website.  It supports various authentication methods, session management, and advanced features like bypassing Cloudflare and using proxies, all while providing detailed logging.  This allows users to interact with DeepSeek without needing the paid API.
key_features: Automates message sending and response retrieval in DeepSeek
Supports login via token or email/password authentication
Enables session management (reset chat, log out, retrieve token)
Headless mode for running on servers or automation setups
Customizable browser arguments for better control over execution
primary_use_case: Using the DeepSeek website as an alternative API to the DeepSeek paid API

name: bananas
description: Bananasüçå, Cross-Platform screen üñ•Ô∏è sharing üì° made simple ‚ö°.
readme_summary: Bananas Screen Sharing is a peer-to-peer screen sharing application for Mac, Windows, and Linux.  It does not require an account and uses stun, turn, and signaling servers only for initial connection establishment.  Users can download releases from GitHub or install via Homebrew on macOS.
key_features: Uses stun, turn, and signaling servers for initial connection

name: StableAnimator
description: [CVPR2025] We present StableAnimator, the first end-to-end ID-preserving video diffusion framework, which synthesizes high-quality videos without any post-processing, conditioned on a reference image and a sequence of poses.
readme_summary: StableAnimator is a novel framework for generating high-fidelity human image animations while preserving identity.  It uses a video diffusion model with several key modules to ensure ID consistency, including a Face Encoder and ID Adapter.  The model also incorporates HJB equation-based optimization for enhanced face quality during inference.
key_features: Conditioned on a reference image and pose sequence
Uses image and face embeddings with off-the-shelf extractors
Global content-aware Face Encoder refines face embeddings
Distribution-aware ID Adapter prevents interference from temporal layers
Hamilton-Jacobi-Bellman (HJB) equation-based optimization enhances face quality during inference
